title: BBC Local Live: Norfolk - BBC News
summary: project to inspire young people about norfolk 's heritage .

documents.title: that 's all from the norfolk live team
text: our regular news updates have now come to an end for the week - we 'll be back at 08:00 on monday .
any breaking stories will be updated on the site .
have a great weekend .

documents.title: heart surgery causes carrott to cancel concert
text: a re-arranged heart bypass operation has caused comedian jasper carott to cancel the final concert at the holt festival in north norfolk .
the gig was planned for 30 july .
he said : `` whilst it 's not desperate it is obviously something i need to get done as soon as possible .
i sincerely hope i can rearrange the date in the future to make up for it . ''
his manager steve hutt confirmed that it `` was n't a decision we took lightly , previously he has only ever cancelled one gig in his entire career . ''
full ticket refunds will be avaliable .
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: fancy getting into motorsport ? # getinspired
text: here 's red bull team principal christian horner giving you five reasons why motorsport could suit you
and if you want to look into it further , take a look at the get inspired guide .

documents.title: defender marcel franke joins norwich city football club
text: defender marcel franke has been signed by norwich city football club on a three-year-deal from bundesliga ii side greuther fürth for an undisclosed fee .
the 24-year-old centre-back said : `` it was an easy step for me .
i had good conversations with the coach and he convinced me norwich was the right club .
`` i want to play football with the team so i 'm looking forward to this .
`` head coach daniel farke added : `` we were searching for some improvements in defence so i 'm happy .
`` he 's a really solid defender but also solid at building up our game .
marcel is a young guy at just 24 so has lots of potential but is also pretty experienced .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: cantley 's hewett playing in wheelchair doubles after losing singles semi-final
text: we 've reported that britain 's alfie hewett , from cantley in norfolk , went out of the wimbledon men 's wheelchair singles at the semi-final stage after losing against gustavo fernandez .
the argentinean second seed , 23 , avenged his french open final defeat by 19-year-old hewett last month , coming through 4-6 7-6 ( 7-4 ) 6-3 .
the pair face each other again today in the doubles semi-final .
hewett and his british partner gordon reid are defending the title they won at the all england club last year .
compatriots jordanne whiley and lucy shuker are also in doubles action .
whiley and her japanese partner yui kamiji are the defending champions , and face dutch top seeds jiske griffieon and aniek van koot .
shuker takes to the court alongside sabine ellerbrock of germany .
they will play second seeds marjolein buis and diede de groot - also from the netherlands .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: cantley 's alfie hewett knocked out of wimbledon
text: cantley 's alfie hewett has been knocked out of wimbledon after losing his match in the wheelchair tennis semi-final at wimbledon against argentine gustavo fernandez .
hewett , 19 , beat world number five nicolas peifer in three sets , 4-6 , 6-2 , 6-2 to get into the semi final .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: norwich sign german defender franke
text: norwich sign german defender franke

documents.title: knife-crime crackdown in norfolk
text: norfolk police is taking part in a national week-long operation to tackle the issue of knife crime .
between 17 july and and 22 july 2017 , operation sceptre will be targeting offenders who use and carry knives as well as highlighting the risks of carrying a bladed weapon .
officers across the county will be carrying out high-visibility patrols to disrupt crime gangs and associated gang activity who carry and use knives .

documents.title: from the archives : bomber at raf watton in 1940
text: seventy seven years ago this month , a photographer took this of a bristol blenheim mk iv , yh-b light bomber aircraft of no 21 squadron in the raf warms up its engines before take-off in 1940 .
based at raf watton in norfolk , the aircraft was shot down in july the following year during a raid on rotterdam .

documents.title: from the archives : holidaymakers on norfolk broads 1926
text: ninety one years ago this month , holidaymakers playing music with homemade instruments on board a narrow boat on the norfolk broads were caught on camera .

documents.title: chaos at king 's lynn stars
text: king 's lynn stars ' rider chris holder will face punishment from the club after he refused to ride during the 52-40 defeat against poole pirates last night .
several riders were not happy with the state of the track , claiming it was rutted and too grippy for racing .
holder , the 2012 world champion , refused to race later in the meeting and was fined by the referee .
stars boss buster chapman told bbc radio norfolk after the meeting he would face furthur punishment .
it 's not good for the public , it 's not good for the sport we are absolutely killing ourselves in this sport . ''
the meeting had further drama when team manager dale allitt was taken to hospital mid-meeting with chest pains .
author: Phil Daley
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: bid to find wartime photo album owner
text: bid to find wartime photo album owner

documents.title: king 's lynn missing man inquiry : body found
text: police looking for a king 's lynn man say a man 's body has been found in humberside .
it was found last sunday in woodland in sutton on hull and is thought to be that of chris nicholls , although formal identification has n't yet taken place .
the death is not being treated as sus

documents.title: sheringham lifeboats through the years
text: we reported earlier that there are big celebrations this weekend as the rnli marks 150 years in sheringham .
we thought we 'd look at some of its lifeboats over the years .
the lifeboat foresters ' centenary ( above ) entered service in 1936 and continued until 1961 .
she was launched 129 times and saved 82 lives .
the jc madge ( above ) was launched in 1904 and continued in service until 1936 .
rowed by 16 oars , she helped save 58 lives .
the william bennett ( above ) arrived in sheringham in july 1886 .
she was a difficult boat to launch and so only made four successful service launches in its 18 year career , saving 11 lives .

documents.title: town celebrates lifeboats in sheringham
text: there are big celebrations this weekend as the rnli marks 150 years in sheringham .
the first rnli lifeboat at sheringham was the duncan ( above ) , built at a cost of £ 345 donated by mrs. agnes fraser ( nee duncan ) in memory of her father and uncle .
the duncan remained in service for 19 years , saving 18 lives
it was placed in a purpose built lifeboat house in july 1867 which has now been refurbished and renamed the oddfellows hall ( above ) .
this sunday there 's a grand parade in the north norfolk fishing town and seaside resort .
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

documents.title: off-duty policemen were 'argumentative and belligerent ' during hotel party row
text: essex police have said the dismissal of one officer and a severe warning for another followed an hour of rowdy behaviour when they were off-duty at a hotel in norwich .
pc jason munns was sacked , while pc luke salmon was given a final written warning by a police conduct panel yesterday .

the colchester-based officers had been at a travelodge for a colleague 's hen party in june last year , when they got into a row about their behaviour with hotel staff and norfolk police were called .
after yesterday 's hearing , essex 's ch supt rachel nolan said their behaviour fell `` well below '' the standards expected of serving officers .
she said : `` the officers did not comply with warnings from hotel staff , then on police attendance , were argumentative and belligerent , disputing points of law .
`` both identified themselves as essex police officers during the incident , which lasted for more than an hour on a friday night .
`` whilst both officers have apologised , the public rightly expect police officers to display high standards of behaviour whether on or off duty . ''

documents.title: project to inspire young people about norfolk 's heritage
text: a project which aims to inspire young people about the history of norfolk has been awarded a £ 776,500 heritage lottery fund ( hlf ) grant .
the kick the dust programme , run by norfolk museums service , will use the money to help involve about 8,000 people aged between 11 and 25 in heritage schemes .
the museum is working in partnership with ymca norfolk and creative collisions - great yarmouth .
taking place at heritage sites across the county , including gressenhall farm and workhouse and norwich castle , the young people will have the chance to play a role in shaping their heritage .
joining the scheme at a level that suits them , young people can :

tim sweeting , ceo of ymca norfolk said : `` it is wonderful that hlf is funding partnerships including youth organisations like ymca in order to engage non-traditional groups , because we believe all young people deserve the opportunity to be inspired by heritage . ''
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

documents.title: video : weather forecast
text: early showers will give way to a dry day with temperatures peaking at 20c ( 68f ) across the bbc east region .
the weekend will also be mostly dry , but cloudy .
here 's my full forecast :

documents.title: good morning norfolk
text: welcome back to bbc local live for norfolk .
the team will be bringing you up to date news , sport and weather from now until 18:00 .
among other stories today we 'll be previewing big celebrations this weekend as the rnli marks 150 years in sheringham .
if you 've got a story you want to tell us about , do n't hesitate to get in touch by clicking `` get involved '' above .
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

text: our regular news updates have now come to an end for today - we 'll be back at 08:00 tomorrow .
here 's a quick look at what 's been happening across the county today :
scroll down for more on these , and other stories .
we 'll leave you with this fab photo taken mid-afternoon by weather watcher jo .

documents.title: overnight weather : milder with some showers later
text: this evening cloud will continue to develop from the north bringing the small chance of an isolated shower .
overnight another band of showers will cross the bbc east region during the early hours .
it 'll be milder than last night , with lows of 12c ( 54f ) .
friday will be mainly dry but rather cloudy , with the chance of a further isolated shower .
feeling cooler with highs of 19c ( 66f ) .
get a full forecast where you live from bbc weather .
author: Alex Dolan
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: armed officers deployed to latitude
text: norfolk police are sending armed officers to the latitude festival from today and over the weekend do n't forget to say hello .
if you 're attending @ twitterid please come and say hello to our officers !

documents.title: ndr : the latest travel updates
text: here 's the latest travel information we have for motorists , with regards to construction of the northern distributor road ( ndr ) :
the two-week closure of buxton road which had been planned for next week has been postponed , so as not to clash with the overnight closures on north walsham road .
holly lane , which had been scheduled to close for good tomorrow will now remain open until friday , 12 july .

the permanent closure of holt road and rerouting of the b1149 traffic on to new drayton lane wo n't take place until the end of august - this is because the diversion of bt cables can not begin until after the world athletics championships .

documents.title: go on i dare you
text: are you brave enough to give this a go ?
it 's a 45m ( 148ft ) tall slingshot , which will fling you 60m ( 197ft ) skyhigh - do n't worry , you 'll be safely secured in a capsule .
the temporary tourist attraction in great yarmouth has come a long way- it was previously based in dubai .
fearless adrenaline seekers should make their way to the town 's seafront - the slingshot opens tomorrow , and will remain open at peak times and weekends during the summer holiday season .

documents.title: photos : behind-the-scenes at raf marham
text: work is well under way at raf marham as the west norfolk airbase prepares to welcome the next generation of fast jets .
next summer , the air base will become home to the f-35 lightning ii .
construction of the new facilities is a massive undertaking - it 's taking place at the same time as marham 's tornadoes continue combat operations in the middle east .
look east 's cameras were today given access behind-the-scenes :

documents.title: milestone reached at marham airbase
text: the infrastructure project to accommodate new fighter jets at raf marham has passed a milestone .
a £ 250m project is half way through transforming the base to meet the needs of the f-35 lightning jets when they arrive in summer next year .
work includes resurfacing two existing runways and taxiways .
a new purpose built hangar is also being constructed to house the jets .
air commodore david bradshaw told me the old hangars were built back in the 1930s as the royal air force and the nation prepared for world war two , and were n't designed for modern aircraft .

they 've given us extraordinary service but it 's time to move to the next generation that suits a fifth generation aircraft like the f-35 shoe-horning it in to an old hangar is feasible but you get a sub-optimal output as a result . ''
author: Jill Bennett
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: fines for school-term holiday 'a victory ' says dad
text: a couple from norfolk have been told to pay £ 450 in fines and charges for taking their children out of school in term time .
tracey and andrew bucket , who live in drayton , took their three children on holiday to the algarve in october last year .
although one school approved the absence , the other two did not and the pair were prosecuted by norfolk county council at norwich magistrates ' court this morning .
mr buckett says despite the fines the trip was still cheaper than paying for a holiday during the school holidays .

i think it 's a victory today , it could have gone bad for us but we stood to our guns we think the whole system is unfair , to be dictated to by the schools when , and when we can not , take our kids out of school - i think those legislations need to be changed . ''
author: Jo Thewlis
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: hewett through to wimbledon semi-final
text: cantley 's alfie hewett is through to the semi-finals of the wheelchair singles at wimbledon .
hewett beat world number five nicolas peifer in three sets , 4-6 , 6-2 , 6-2 .
the 19-year-old now faces stephane houdet or gustavo fernandez in the last four .
author: Rob Butler
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: murphy speculation intensifies
text: speculation surrounding the future of norwich city winger jacob murphy is intensifying .
newcastle united are said to be interested in signing the england u21 international .
some reports are suggesting that he wants to leave carrow road and that his representatives are meeting with norwich city today .
the club has declined to make an official comment on the speculation .
author: Chris Goreham
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: hen party pc sacked for misconduct
text: hen party pc sacked for misconduct

documents.title: fast jets training under way
text: the £ 250m project to transform raf marham into the headquarters of the new generation of warplanes has passed the halfway mark .
the lightning ii 's of no 617 squadron , the dambusters , arrive next summer .
they will operate out of one of the most advanced facilities in the raf .
air commodore david bradshaw is the commander of the lightning force , and he tells me training is under way .

we 've placed our royal air force and royal navy pilots and support personnel within a us marine corps squadron and they 're learning how the aircraft operates , how it 's sustained and everything we need to understand about the aircraft before we bring it back to the uk at some point next year . ''
author: Jill Bennett
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: police officers ' hen party behaviour was a 'disgrace '
text: as we reported yesterday , two essex pcs were found guilty of gross misconduct for their behaviour at a hotel during a hen party in june 2016 .
a police conduct panel heard that jason munns and luke salmon - both colchester-based constables - were asked to leave the norwich travelodge before police were called .
today , pc munns was dismissed without notice and pc salmon was given a final written warning .
the panel chair said pc salmon 's conduct on the night in question was `` just as much of a disgrace '' as that of pc munns , and could undermine public confidence in the police force .

but he added that salmon `` recognised the seriousness of his conduct '' and had `` insight into the impact of his behaviour '' while munns had failed to take on board a `` dressing down '' he had in 2010 while on probation .
both men were `` dedicated officers who performed to a high standard '' , the hearing was told .
author: Jodie Halford
BBC News

documents.title: breakinghen party officer sacked for misconduct
text: a police officer has been sacked after he and a colleague became so `` noisy and rowdy '' at a hotel that police had to be called .
essex pcs jason munns and luke salmon had been out on fellow officer esther butcher 's hen party in june 2016 .
a police conduct panel found them guilty of gross misconduct after hearing they were asked to leave norwich travelodge because of their behaviour .
pc munns was dismissed without notice while pc salmon was given a final written warning .
author: Jodie Halford
BBC News

documents.title: fair weather over norfolk
text: temperatures this afternoon are expected to peak at 21c ( 70f ) , and we can expect sunny spells with a few isolated showers .
there 's no sign of any raindrops on roses in this latest selection of photos from our weather watchers :

documents.title: job centres to move into council offices
text: details have been released of the plans to move two of the county 's job centres .
the sites in thetford ( and king 's lynn are going to move into the local council offices .
stephen lankaster , who runs norfolk 's network of job centres , says no staff will lose their jobs in the change planned for march next year .

we 're looking at recruiting more staff at the moment because we 're running universal credit full service in all 24 extra sites other than yarmouth and lowestoft that are already there over the next 12-14 months we 've got a really busy period . ''
author: Clare Worden
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: could you help save a life ?
text: the rnli is looking for waterside volunteers to help save lives on the broads waterways .
free training and equipment is being offered to staff at pubs , restaurants and shops to help prevent drowning .
the pilot scheme will see potentially lifesaving `` throw bags '' at key inns , and staff will be trained to use them (
ben mitchell , along with fellow members of the happisburgh rnli , will help deliver the training .
he says the idea behind training restaurant and bar staff is that they are the ones who 'll be there at times when risk is most prevalent .

research shows that a significant proportion of drownings involve people visiting pubs and bars near water and then getting into distress it could be someone taking a seemingly innocent swim and suffering cold water shock , or it could be through an accident where someone never intended to be in the water . ''

documents.title: landmark diner to close its doors
text: you ca n't fail to miss the striking figure of uncle sam by the roadside when driving down the a11 attleborough bypass .
the 8ft character stands by mr d 's - a 1950's-style american-style diner .
inside it 's ty of the era , with pink and turquoise padded seating , a jukebox and there 's even a harley davidson in the entrance .
but the south norfolk landmark is soon to be no more .
after years of trading , owner phil dingle has decided to put his feet up and retire .
next thursday , the diners ' doors will close for the final time in it 's place will be a coffee shop .
all the contents will be sold off even uncle sam .
i keep telling my wife i 'm going to put uncle sam at the bottom of my drive , but she 's not too keen , so i think i 'll have to sell him as well . ''
author: Wally Webb
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: breakingcanaries confirm departure of goalkeeping coach
text: dean kiely has left his role as norwich city 's goalkeeping coach .
in a short statement , released this morning , the canaries have now confirmed his departure after just over two years at carrow road .
kiely was n't with the team when they played at stevenage in a pre-season friendly earlier this week .
author: Chris Goreham
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: the pressure is on for alfie hewett
text: norfolk 's wheelchair superstar alfie hewett is back in action today , competing in the singles quarter finals at wimbledon .
the 19-year-old will also attempt to defend the doubles title he won last year at sw19 with gordon reid (
alfie 's granddad david hooper has been with him in wimbledon all week , and his family will be there today to watch him play .
mr hooper told bbc radio norfolk 's nick conrad that the pressure is on .
`` this time last year , alfie was a wildcard , he had no pressure at all , today it 's a different story .
it 's pretty nerve-wracking for us to watch alfie on the court , he 's in the zone , playing , in control we ca n't do anything . ''
this morning alfie will have a training session at 10:30 , and will probably be due on court around 12:30 .
he plays in a specialised sports chair for wheelchair tennis , all bespoke for him , with special supports back and front to keep him from falling out .
as for playing on grass compared to hard courts , mr hooper says it 's much more difficult for wheelchair tennis players on grass .
`` recently alfie played at surbiton ( although they were really nice grass courts the grass was too good , so everybody kept falling out of their chairs .

even if they do n't fall out of the chair , they still have the problem of pushing - which puts a lot of pressure on the shoulders , because wheels spin on grass , so there 's a good chance of injuring themselves , the grip is n't there . ''
the 19-year-old faces many more years of playing , as tennis players can go on into their 30s .
he has to plan ahead , his next goal will be tokyo for the next three years he has his schedule worked out , he 's got a goal to aim for . ''

documents.title: canaries give games to trialists at the walks
text: norwich city used last night 's friendly at king 's lynn town to run the rule over two trialists .
former liverpool midfielder adam phillips ( and 19-year old belgian striker pierre xavier fonkeu both featured as a city under-23 side won 4-1 at the walks .
norwich won the match 4-1 .
out-of-favour french midfielder tony andreu scored twice with michee efete and todd cantwell also on target .
the linnets had taken an early lead in their opening friendly of the summer with a goal from leon mettam .
author: Chris Goreham
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: brilliant away win for king 's lynn stars
text: king 's lynn stars moved up to third in speedway 's premiership after a rare win at poole pirates .
former poole rider chris holder top scored with 13 as the stars romped to a 49-44 victory .
it 's only the second time in 17 years that lynn have won at wimborne road .
king 's lynn do n't have long to celebrate that win .
the two sides meet again tonight , this time in norfolk .
celebrate a fine 49-44 win for # ourstars at poole with our heat-by-heat report & reaction from @ twitterid
superb mate ! !
let 's hammer them at home !
up the stars
author: Chris Goreham
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: mp to chair influential committee
text: norman lamb has been chosen by fellow mps to chair one of parliament 's influential committees .
the liberal democrat mp for north norfolk will oversee the science and technology committee which scrutinises government policy and holds ministers to account .
mr lamb said he 'd ensure that the world of science is n't forgotten in the forthcoming brexit negotiations .
the conservative mp for south norfolk , richard bacon , failed in his attempt to lead the treasury select committee .
author: Andrew Sinclair
BBC Look East political correspondent

documents.title: hewett begins bid for wimbledon glory
text: cantley 's alfie hewett starts his campaign to win the wimbledon wheelchair tennis title today .
the 19-year old faces nicolas piefer , the world number 5 , in the quarter finals .
that match is due to be second on court 17 .
hewett will also attempt to defend the doubles title he won last year at sw19 alongside gordon reid .
since winning that crown last year hewett has won the french open singles title as well as two paralympic silvers .

documents.title: wednesday weather : staying dry and sunny into tomorrow
text: tonight : staying dry with further spells of sunshine and patchy cloud across the east .
clear spells and light winds will develop overnight .
expect a little bit of mist in there .
lows of 10c ( 50f ) .
tomorrow : a dry and bright start with sunny spells , but it 'll turn cloudier later with the chance of an isolated shower .
winds will be light , south-westerly .
highs of 21c ( 70f ) .
weather has more .

BBC Look East weather

documents.title: 'rowdy ' police officers guilty of misconduct
text: two officers who became so 'noisy and rowdy ' in a hotel that the police had to be called have been found guilty of gross misconduct .
essex pcs jason munns and luke salmon had been out celebrating fellow officer esther butcher 's hen party in june 2016 .
a police conduct panel heard the two colchester-based constables ended up at the norwich travelodge where they were confronted by the night manager about their behaviour .
after the panel found the pair guilty of gross misconduct they apologised for their actions .
author: Laurence Cawley
BBC News

documents.title: alderman primary head concerned about move
text: we 're sticking with education here
a public meeting will be held in great yarmouth tonight to discuss the proposed closure of alderman swindell primary .
education officers at norfolk county council want the pupils to transfer to a new £ 7m building at nearby north denes primary and merge the two schools .
but the head at alderman , alison hopley , says this plan has implications for staffing .
`` i have been told it 's a case of lifting and shifting .
all the children are moved , but all my staff lose their jobs , unless there are any vacancies , '' she said .
the head says north denes primary is over-staffed at present .
`` they need our children , they do n't need our staff , '' she said .
the county council says it is still consulting on the merger and no decisions have been made yet .
author: Tim Addicott
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: west norfolk academy taken over
text: staying with education a west norfolk academy school is being taken over by a new trust .
downham market academy was rated inadequate by ofsted .
the cambridgeshire educational trust has confirmed it is taking over the school .
south west norfolk mp elizabeth truss said : `` the trust has a track record of excellent results .
its founding school , chesterton academy in cambridge , is in the top five percent of schools in the country for achievement . ''

documents.title: notre dame high wins cash to help improve teaching methods
text: notre dame high in norwich has won funding to improve the quality of teaching in the county through better use of research in the classroom .
as one of 11 research schools established since 2016 , it will receive £ 200,000 over three years to boost training and teaching standards .

brian conway , headteacher at notre dame said : `` there are many schools in norwich who have supported and guided our proposal for a research school and we are excited about how we can develop the use of effective research to further improve teaching and learning . ''
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC News

documents.title: icymi - 'tennis saved my life ' # getinspired
text: in case you missed it in yesterday 's coverage , this is a great story about how tennis can transform lives .
four years ago tony costa from llandudno in north wales weighed 26-and-a-half stone , having struggled to deal with the death of his five-month-old son .
he lost some weight through a diet club but had `` plateaued '' and was `` losing interest '' and needed something to keep him going .
`` tennis came at the right time , '' tony says .
this year tony 's son would 've been 20 years old and he and his wife caroline held a memorial tennis match at a local club .
`` we shone some light on some darkness - and we have tennis to thank for that . ''
if you want to follow tony 's lead and get into tennis , read our get inspired guide .

documents.title: absentee landlord fined over derelict property
text: builders have started to make secure a building which the council had to take emergency action on .

the vacant floors above the coral betting shop on saint peters road in great yarmouth were infested with pigeons and squatters have been living there too.landlord ronald collins , of east finchley in london , and was fined £ 20,000 and ordered to pay emergency repairs to the council of £ 5,600 and £ 4,000 in court costs .
now the builders are on site removing loose masonry and boarding up exposed parts of the building .
one of the workers told me they will be spending at least three weeks on the exterior of the property but the project to put the upper stories back into use will take around four months .
author: Andrew Turner
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: wafting whiff of 'weed ' to be mapped
text: wafting whiff of 'weed ' to be mapped

documents.title: tougher airgun measures sought after pet and bird attacks
text: there were nearly 900 air gun attacks on animals in england and wales last year according to figures obtained by bbc local radio .
tiffany leader 's cat baillie was shot while on the roof at their home in norwich in may .
it suffered a shattered hip and a severe leg fracture .
the family have seven cats .
the cats protection charity says it now wants air guns to be licensed .
but critics say this would massively increase the police 's workload .
`` they 're already hard pressed to keep up with licensing demands they have now and we know there are about five million airguns in england and wales .
`` it would be a horrendous task , '' says colin seddon , of the british association for shooting and conservation .
author: Wally Webb
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: man get suspended sentence for stealing £ 100,000
text: a property manager who stole almost £ 100,000 has been given a suspended jail sentence .
stephen webster , 38 , from norwich road in dereham , who had a drug habit , pleaded guilty to two charges of theft at norwich crown court .
webster kept his addictions secret from his wife and father , siphoning off cash from his clients .
the court heard he stole £ 97,000 from one , and almost £ 700 from another .

during mitigation , it was heard that webster had two previous convictions - one for stealing from camden borough council in the late 90s and another more recently of being in possession of a large quantity of cocaine .
but his defence said he sought help for his addiction before the prosecution proceedings began and has paid back more than £ 30,000 to his victims .
sentencing webster , who now works as a warehouseman , recorder frank burton told him he was `` on the very edge of a custodial sentence . ''
he was given a 20-month term suspended for two years and ordered to do 200 hours of unpaid work .
author: Andrew Turner
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: thief 'injures herself ' with cheese grater
text: a pub manager from gorleston has been jailed after admitting to two counts of theft and perverting the course of justice .
jayne gill , 49 , from magdelene square , gorleston who ran the dukes head hotel in great yarmouth , admitted stealing almost £ 3,000 and falsely claiming that she had been robbed .
the prosecution at norwich crown court said when bar owner jason barker hired gill , he had heard she was untrustworthy .
but she allayed those fears and she started working for him at the feathers in gorleston .
she stole £ 1,165 from the bar towards the end of 2016 but the theft went unnoticed .
she then transfered to the dukes head , where in late january she stole £ 1,648 , but told police she had been robbed in an alleyway .
the court heard she attacked herself on the face using a cheese grater , and when officers checked cctv , they said she already had an injury to her face and that no-one else entered the alleyway .
in mitigation , it was heard that gill was hooked on cocodamol painkillers and had started using cocaine , clocking up £ 2,000 of debt .
she was jailed for a total of nine months .
author: Andrew Turner
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: new roof for city hall proposed
text: leaks to city hall 's roof means it now needs an overhaul .
officers say the roof , which has been patched up over the years , needs a new waterproof membrane which would ensure the roof stays sound for 20 years .
a report going before coucnillors this evening says : `` the existing mastic asphalt roof is in need of major repairs .
`` water is leaking through the asphalt into the concrete roof structure where it is tracking along the heating pipes in the ceiling , causing them to corrode and leak water from the heating system .
`` the application of a new membrane will remove the need to re-apply solar reflective paint every two to five years and hence help reduce future maintenance liabilities . ''
councillors will have to decide whether to award a contract for the new membrane out of the city 's £ 283,000 roof budget .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC News

documents.title: ivo pinto faces race to be fit
text: norwich city defender ivo pinto faces a race to be fit for the new season .
manager daniel farke confirmed that pinto will miss the rest of the pre-season matches following city 's 2-2 draw at league two stevenage last night in their latest summer friendly .
nelson oliviera and alex pritchard were on the scoresheet .
portuguese pinto has a hamstring injury and will aim to be fit for city 's championship opener at fulham on august 5 .
author: Rob Butler
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: mps hope to chair influential committees
text: two norfolk mps will find out if they will be chairs of influential parliamentary committees .
the north norfolk mp , norman lamb is seen as the favourite to chair the science and technology committee .
meanwhile richard bacon , the south norfolk mp is vying to lead the treasury committee .
they 'll find out if they 've got the role when mps vote on the appointments this afternoon .
author: Tim Addicott
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: criminal behaviour orders fail to tackle rising homeless
text: earlier we told you about a charity 's concern that criminal behavioural orders , cbos , are unfairly affecting the growing numbers sleeping rough .
jacqui mccluskey , of homeless link , the national membership organisation for homelessness charities in england , said issuing cbos to those most in need was `` no answer '' .
`` the priority needs to be tackling the root causes of homelessness , rather than punishing the most vulnerable in society . ''
sgt mark shepherd , public order tactical adviser for norwich , says the orders allowed individuals access to the services they needed , and did not accept they led to further crime .
`` each one is for an individual person , at the same time identifying those services that can take them away from their offending lifestyle . ''
meanwhile a home office spokesperson said : `` we are determined to help the most vulnerable in society . ''
author: Robby West
BBC Look East

documents.title: court orders criminalising homeless , charity claims
text: court orders being imposed on homeless people are `` criminalising those most in need , '' a charity has said .
criminal behaviour orders ( cbos ) give courts powers including banning people from areas or from drinking in public .
but the charity homeless link said cbos , which replaced anti-social behaviour orders ( asbos ) , prevented homeless people from accessing vital services .

dale parker , co-founder of the people 's picnic , which provides homecooked meals to help vulnerable people in norwich , said cbos failed to address the underlying issues of criminal behaviour and isolated the most vulnerable homeless people .
`` the majority of services and outlets where people come to get food or the basics are in the city , '' he said .
`` more often than not , the only crime those people have committed is the crime of being poor . ''
the home office said local agencies must determine whether their use of their powers was appropriate .
author: Robby West
BBC Look East

documents.title: more details on the lack of hospital beds in the east
text: east anglia 's hospitals are close to being full - with three in essex already admitting they have no spare beds , the bbc can reveal .

hospitals are usually under greater pressure in the colder winter months but the boss of colchester and ipswich hospital nick hulme says `` the pressure on the nhs is no longer seasonal '' but all year round .
the queen elizabeth hospital in kings lynn had just four beds available on tuesday night - and the james paget in gorleston had 12 spare beds .
we have not received a figure from the norwich and norfolk hospital .
population growth as well as increasing demand on hospital services is part of the reason for the hospitals being stretched .
but the number of beds being taken up by patients who medically do not need to be treated - often dubbed 'bed-blockers ' or 'delayed discharges ' - is still high at many hospitals .
there are 355 beds in east anglia currently taken up by patients who medically do not need to be in hospital .
most are waiting for a care package either at home or to move into a care home .
essex has 283 patients waiting to leave .
the james paget did not provide a figure .
author: Simon Dedman
BBC Essex political reporter

documents.title: earliest barley harvest in years
text: some norfolk farmers say they 're harvesting barley up to three weeks early this year .
combines were out as early as 3 june .
norfolk is famous for its high quality barley , much of which is used in brewing beer .
ed lankfer has been farming with his dad for 21 years at wereham near downham market and says this is the earliest he 's known the crop to be ready :

`` the extreme weather temperature which forced the plants through all the growth stages and then when it got to the final growth stage of the ripening , instead of actually ripening and maturing it was just burnt off by 30 degree heat . ''
mr lankfer says considering the lack of rain last month the crop has yielded well .
`` it looks nice in the store and i hope it meets the benchmark , '' he added .
the farming programme on bbc radio 4 has more on the early harvest
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC News

documents.title: wells lifeboat to the rescue - again !
text: the wells lifboat was called to the aid of two people and a dog in a kayak trying to get into blakeney harbour .
it happened at around 12:30 yesterday after a strong outgoing tide made it impossible for them to return to shore without help .
they were towed to safety by the lifeboat .
the incident is the vessel 's fourth callout in three days .
author: Clare Worden
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: football fans upset over betting company branding on city shirts
text: norwich city football club is defending its decision not to offer fans a shirt without the name of its main sponsor .
some fans , including parents of children who are too tall for the junior unbranded shirts , say they do n't want to promote sponsor betting company leo vegas .
caroline clarke from thorpe hamlet contacted the club asking for an unbranded adult shirt for her 12-year-old son .
but she was n't happy with the response .
`` all i got from the club was generic emails repeating that they were going to be working with gambling charities and there will be no exception for adult shirts .
`` there was absolutely no acknowledgement whatsoever that my query did n't relate to an adult wanting a logo free shirt , it related to an under-18 . ''
norwich city says for contractual and logistical reasons they are unable to supply adult shirts without the leo vegas branding .
it said this partnership with a responsible betting company was a carefully considered arrangement .
author: Clare Worden
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: hospitals in the east close to full capacity : bbc figures
text: east anglia 's hospitals are close to being full , the bbc can reveal .
hospitals are usually under greater pressure in the colder winter months , but the boss of colchester and ipswich hospital , nick hulme , says `` the pressure on the nhs is no longer seasonal '' .
three acute hospitals in essex have no spare beds at all .
the west suffolk hospital in bury st edmunds and queen elizabeth in king 's lynn both had just four beds available .
ipswich hospital has yet to provide figures .
population growth and increasing demand on hospital services is also part of the reason for the hospitals being stretched .
but the number of beds being taken up by patients who medically do not need to be treated - often dubbed 'bed-blockers ' or 'delayed discharges ' - is still high at many hospitals .
there are 355 beds in east anglia currently taken up by patients who medically do not need to be in hospital .
author: Simon Dedman
Health Correspondent, Look East

documents.title: missing norwich woman found safe and well
text: police have confirmed a 30-year-old woman reported missing from norwich yesterday has been found .
eve sizeland was found safe and well in north norfolk .

documents.title: weather : pleasant day ahead
text: it will be a cloudy and drizzly start , but this will soon thin during the morning as all parts become dry , with long sunny periods throughout the afternoon and evening .
the wind will be mainly light and as a result it will feel much warmer than on tuesday .
maximum temperature : 20c ( 68f ) .
weather has more .
author: Lucy Martin
BBC Weather

documents.title: norfolk live on wednesday
text: morning and welcome back to the live stream for norfolk where you can find out about the latest news , sport , travel and weather as they affect the county .
the team are here until 18:00 and if you 'd like to share a news story or have a view on anything you 've read do contact us via the `` get involved '' button at the top of this page .
it 's a wet start to today but the sun is set to come out to play later this afternoon ; a full forecast is up next .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC News

documents.title: travelodge hen do pcs 'noisy and rowdy '
text: travelodge hen do pcs 'noisy and rowdy '

documents.title: our live coverage today
text: thanks for your company today we 're now calling it a wrap .
our next scheduled news updates will appear from 08:00 tomorrow .
here 's a quick recap of some of the stories we 've brought you today :
scroll down to find out more on these and our other news bites .
have a safe journey home it 's going to be a wet night for most , with the rain turning heavy in places .
this was the scene in north norfolk a short while ago :
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: veteran of 'the few ' honoured for wartime defence
text: they were known as `` the few '' - the fighter pilots who helped win the battle of britain in 1940 .
tom neil , who lives near bungay , is just one of 11 veterans still alive .
wing commander neil is 97 years old , but as a young man of 19 he was in the thick of air battle , flying a hurricane to help save this country from nazi invasion .

today , mr neil was one of a number of veterans honoured at a special celebration at raf coningsby in lincolnshire , where the duke of cambridge was attending an air display marking the 60th anniversary of the battle of britain memorial flight ( bbmf ) .
the bbmf was formed on 11 july 1957 , by a former battle of britain hurricane pilot , who set about preserving and collecting examples of the main aircraft involved in the conflict .
author: Mike Liggins
BBC Look East

documents.title: plot the pot : council needs help to pinpoint 'cannabis smell '
text: if you live along the cambridgeshire/norfolk border and have a strong sense of smell - fenland district council needs you .
the environmental health team is investigating a strong whiff of cannabis wafting between the two counties .
in a facebook post it 's calling on the public to `` assist with 'odour mapping ' to pinpoint its source '' .

`` when reporting the cannabis odour , please tell us the postcode/location of the smell ( where you were when you smelt it ) , the date and time you smelt it , and , if possible , the wind direction at the time , '' the appeal reads .
if you sniff something - you can alert the council here .

documents.title: evening weather forecast : keep your brolly to hand
text: tonight : cloudy across the bbc east region with outbreaks of rain .
showers will become more persistent and heavy into the night , with light winds becoming northerly .
lows of 13c ( 55f ) .
tomorrow : a cloudy , damp start across the south of the patch .
the rain will clear and it 'll become dry with sunny spells .
but it 'll be a fresh one - with a chilly northerly wind .
highs of 20c ( 68f ) in the south and west , 16-17c ( 61-62f ) further north and east .
author: Alex Dolan
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: one from the archives
text: this was the scene at pulham airfield in norfolk on 13 july , 1919 , when crowds turned out to cheer the pilot and crew of the r-34 airship .
it had just completed the first two-way crossing of the atlantic .
the airship had set off in the early hours of 2 july , complete with crew , supplies and equipment - plus a stowaway and a small tabby kitten .
after more than 100 hours in flight , it touched down in the usa .
three days later , it began its journey back to england .
the return trip took three days , three hours and three minutes the ship travelled 7,420 miles at an average speed of 43mph .
the latest version of an airship successfully took off from cardington in bedfordshire in may , having crashed on its previous test flight .

documents.title: ultrafast broadband coming to great yarmouth
text: homes and businesses in great yarmouth will soon have access to ultrafast broadband .
virgin media plans to extend its ultrafast network to 5,000 properties .
work is due to begin this month , and is expected to be completed before the end of 2019 .
it will give people access to internet speeds of up to 300 megabits per second .

documents.title: wheelchair tennis draws now online
text: the full draw for the wheelchair tennis events at wimbledon is now available on the tournament website .
cantley 's olympic medalist and french open title holder alfie hewett is one of eight players in the gentlemen 's singles .
he 's unseeded , but his doubles partner gordon reid is the number one seed .
the only other seeded player is argentina 's gustavo fernandez .
hewett plays nicolas peifer of france in the first round/quarter finals .
in the aforementioned gentlemen 's doubles , hewett and reid are the second seeds .
they play fernandez and his partner shingo kunieda of japan in their opening match which , as there are only four pairs , starts at the semi-final stage .
the number one seeds in the doubles are peifer and his partner - fellow frenchman stephane houdet .
the wheelchair events get under way on thursday .

documents.title: have your lost your bike ?
text: if so , do any of these four belong to you ?
they were recovered by norfolk police on thursday , and it 's believed they were stolen from the magdalen area of gorleston .
if you can help identify the owners of these cycles , officers would like to hear from you .
a teenage boy was arrested in connection with the theft of cycles , and has now been released from custody .
he remains under investigation while inquiries continue .

documents.title: cracking down on drivers using mobiles at the wheel
text: as we reported yesterday , norfolk police have begun a week-long campaign to drive home the message of the dangers of using a mobile device at the wheel .
and it 's not just aimed at those inside vehicles :
earlier this year , nearly 1,000 motorists across norfolk and suffolk were nabbed for using their phones when driving :
# rcrt were shocked to even catch a motorcyclist checking phone whilst riding on # opringtone today in # norwich # fatal4 # 845
see it increasingly with moped riders
constantly see moped riders check it or ride whilst texting with one hand in my area .
usually underdressed , they 'll learn one way or another
sadly a real life lesson is the only effective one .
does also mean @ twitterid may have more work to do as well .
sadly yes , whilst in his medic role rather than engaged/educator role
he should be arrested for wearing a t shirt !
since when were t-shirts illegal ? ?
on a motorcycle ! ! !
unless he wants to leave his flesh scraped along the road if he comes off
well , that 's his ( not very wise ) choice .
it 's nothing to do with anyone but him .
what would you arrest him for ? ?
aah i see !
question : is n't the rider at red lights ?
is that still breaking law if looking at phone whilst waiting at traffic lights ?
yes if the engine is running .
his parents wo n't be surprised if they get bad news at some point in the future what an idiot
have plenty of time to check phone from hospital bed - so not worth it
and wearing a t-shirt say goodbye to your skin
notice he has a l plate at front , clearly still has a lot to learn !
most of the ones i see around brighton , are unfortunately working for well known food delivery companies
i v seen ped riders using their phones .
or should i say cockwombles
how does stop start vehicles work in relation to law if engine off
between january & april , across norfolk & suffolk , 981 drivers were caught using their mobiles .
far too many .
please do n't be next # fatal4
is that this year ?
yes , january to april this year

documents.title: concern grows for missing woman
text: police are appealing for help to find a woman from norwich who went missing yesterday .
eve sizeland , 30 , was last seen at thorpewood surgery on woodside road shortly after 15:30 .
she 's described as 5ft 3ins ( 1.6m ) tall , of a slim build , wearing glasses and with her hair tied back in a pony tail .
it 's believed she may be wearing a mint green sleeved top with blue jeans .
they 're appealing for help to trace her vehicle - a blue ford kuga with registration number j99 pds .
officers are growing concerned for her welfare , and ask anyone with information to contact them .

documents.title: cctv images released in rape investigation
text: detectives investigating the rape of a woman in the thorpe st andrew area of norwich have released cctv images of potential witnesses who could hold `` significant information '' about the incident .
the first images shows a man wearing a baseball cap , walking two dogs on a lead , and holding what appears to be a sainsbury 's carrier bag .
he was walking in the direction of the city centre .
the two other images show what looks like a couple walking and holding hands - they 're near to a fish and chip shop .

the attack happened between 21:45 and 22:00 on saturday , 1 july , on the yarmouth road between the rushcutters pub and near to the junction of thunder lane as the 30-year-old woman was walking home from the city .
she is receiving specialist support .
anniversary checks were carried out on saturday , where officers spoke to more than 40 people .
police said cctv has been a key part of their inquiry .
`` i believe these people could hold significant information in relation to this attack and i would urge anyone who recognises themselves or someone they know , to come forward . ''
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: hewitt 's draw revealed as he defends title at wimbledon
text: cantley 's alfie hewett will pair up again with world number one gordon reid as they defend their wimbledon wheelchair men 's doubles title later this week .
reid and hewett face argentina 's gustavo fernandez and japan 's shingo kuneida in the semi-finals in south west london .
no date has been set for the match yet .
the british pair won the championships last year by beating the french duo of stephane houdet and nicolas peifer .
the full wheelchair events draws should appear on the wimbledon website .
author: Rob Butler
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: shrewsbury sign norwich 's morris on loan
text: shrewsbury sign norwich 's morris on loan

documents.title: a wet afternoon ahead
text: come rain or shine , whatever the weather , our bbc weather watchers will be there to capture it with their cameras - take a look at their latest selection from around the county .
as for the rest of the day patchy rain will continue , heavy at times , with temperatures peaking at 19c ( 66f ) .

documents.title: cash boost for market towns
text: five of norfolk 's market towns are to get a cash injection to help regenerate them .
thetford , dereham , attleborough , swaffham ( and watton are to get a cut of £ 230,000 .

the cabinet at breckland council approved the spend for their initiative designed to improve the economic , social and cultural standing of the market towns as they fight to compete against out-of-town shopping .
it 'll build on smaller-scale projects that have brought community christmas events , improved signage and more attractive flowerbeds to the town centres .
the money will also be used to shape a vision for the futures of those market towns .
author: Tim Addicott
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: alfie hewett begins wimbledon campaign against world number 5
text: the draw has been made for the wheelchair tennis men 's singles at wimbledon .
cantley 's alfie hewett will take on the world number five nicholas peifer .
the match , a quarter final , is likely to be played on thursday , weather permitting .
the final is due to take place on sunday , and we 're waiting for the men 's double 's draw .
the full draw should be available on the wimbledon website shortly .
author: Rob Butler
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: pictures : offshore rig arrives for decommissioning
text: back to the story we brought you earlier , of how a new dock for recycling north sea energy rigs has received its first offshore vessel .
this photo shows the shell leman bh1 platform accommodation block - known as the `` topside '' - arriving in the outer harbour at great yarmouth .
the 50m high steel jacket structure that supported it will follow later this month .
the topside , which was used as living quarters for personnel working on the leman bt and leman bk platforms , will now be recycled .

veolia and peterson have the contract for the decommissioning facility and will manage the deconstruction and recycling of both the topsides and jacket structures that comprise around 1,600 tonnes of materials and assets .
recovering offshore production facilities and decommissioning them is routine business for operators as oil and gas platforms reach the end of their productive life .

documents.title: two cars stolen in burglary
text: thieves who broke into a property in south norfolk took a quantity of jewellery - and the keys to two cars .
the burglary happened in fritton at around 16:45 on friday , 30 june , when the offenders stole a grey mitsubishi asx and a mercedes slk 250 .
the mercedes was later found crashed on potters lane in wattlefield a short time later .

the mitsubishi stopped at the scene of the crash , and the male drivers of both cars were seen entering an audi , possibly an a6 , which was travelling in convoy , and speed off towards old buckenham .
the audi was later found abandoned on the acle straight between norwich and great yarmouth on saturday , 1 july .
anyone who saw either vehicle being driven in the area , or who has information about the incident , is asked to contact norfolk police or crimestoppers .

documents.title: tour boat rescues deer from the sea at hunstanton
text: a muntjac deer ( similar to this one ) is recovering after being rescued from the sea off hunstanton .
it was spotted by the crew of the wash monster tour boat .
william sewell said his crew used their rescue training .
`` we have a man-overboard hoop they hooked it and brought it to the side , lassoed it and brought it ashore , '' he said .
it 's not the first time a deer has had to be rescued from the coast around norfolk .
last month , fishermen went to the aid of one off cromer .
and william sewell says they 'd also been involved in an earlier rescue :
once before we saw one it had run off the land at thornham , along the shoreline off the cliffs and headed straight out they 're terrific swimmers , can go about 4 knots . ''

documents.title: norwich bring in boro 's husband
text: norwich bring in boro 's husband

documents.title: witness appeal following serious collision
text: police are appealing for witnesses to a collision involving two vehicles in billingford near dereham yesterday .
a white volvo fm lorry and a white renault hgv cab , travelling in opposite directions , where involved in the incident which happened on the a143 at lower street at about 16:20 .
the renault driver , a man in his 30s , suffered potentially life-changing injuries and was airlifted to addenbrooke 's hospital in cambridge for treatment .
the driver of the volvo , a man in his 60s , suffered broken bones and was taken to the norfolk & norwich university hospital .
police would like to hear from anyone who saw the collision , in particular two cars that stopped at the scene to assist the emergency services , and the driver of a tractor .

documents.title: gas rig ready for scrap in great yarmouth
text: a gas rig that 's reached the end of its life has been brought ashore at great yarmouth 's outer harbour .
the shell leman bh1 platform was built 50 years ago , but has been decommissioned and is ready for scrap .
a giant barge with a 2,200 tonne crane from rotterdam is lowering her on to a special frame on the quayside .
engineers will then cut the legs off the platform and then move her slightly further inland for cutting up and disposal .
the base of the platform is due to arrive within the next 10 days .
author: Andrew Turner
BBC Radio Norfolk
